alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Brown; Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 11 at 9:02AM CST until February 11 at 9:30AM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Eastern Cherry County in north central Nebraska... Southwestern Brown County in north central Nebraska... Northwestern Blaine County in north central Nebraska... * Until 930 AM CST/830 AM MST/. * At 902 AM CST/802 AM MST/, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles east of Kilgore to 13 miles east of Valentine National Wildlife Refuge to 14 miles south of Ainsworth, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 178 and 185. Highway 97 between mile markers 109 and 135. Highway 83 between mile markers 164 and 199. Locations impacted include... Brownlee, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Merritt Reservoir, Elsmere, Crookston, Raven, Moon Lake, Willow Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Long Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River, Anderson Bridge State Wildlife Management Area, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Koshopah, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River, Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area and Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
